name: Marquise Fair Portrait
description: Until the color of a mans skin is of no more significance than the color of his eyes there will be war. Haile Salassie made this quote in his 1930’s address to the United Nations. Later it was popularized by Bob Marley which in turn influenced Marquise Fair. He continues the work of Bob Marley by creating unification music, like his song titled One Race. Which can be heard on Swiss National radio Couleur Troi/Couleur 3. Or on all steaming platforms including his Video on YouTube published by Marquise Fair Music.
